content: Hey all! :wave: We‚Äôve been planning to do some triage in just over 8 hours, looking at issues with a I-nominated label. I‚Äôll drop a Zoom link here closer to the time üôÇ
@Ashley Mannix fwiw if you type <time: you should be able to provide a timezone-aware time for everyone :)
what time is the meeting supposed to be?
agh, i thought it was 2 hours earlier, i won't be able to make it this evening
i need to get it on my calendar i guess
Some timezones moved around a bit last weekend. So the meeting time moved an hour in some places. Not sure which timezone the meeting is pinned to.
Pin<chrono::DateTime> :thinking:
yeah US and europe daylight savings times switch over a week apart, so they should be synced back up next week
Yea but kodraus is in australia right? so i think this might've also moved the opposite direction? not sure, or if im just confused
ah, it's pinned to the Brisbane timezone. i think DST started a few weeks ago there.
yea they moved at the same time as europe, but in the opposite direction
we should clearly all switch to swatch internet time
Whoops! Sorry all I didn‚Äôt realise it was pinned to my tz
In my tz we don‚Äôt do daylight savings üôÇ
I'll pin it to UTC, I thought I had done that. Does the link to the libs calendar from our GitHub repo show Brisbane time for everybody?
Zoom link: https://zoom.us/j/97058729336

The ics file contains:

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART;TZID=Australia/Brisbane:20201006T080000
DTEND;TZID=Australia/Brisbane:20201006T083000

ah no, the 'Libs Regular Meeting' now says

BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTART:20200928T220000Z
DTEND:20200928T223000Z
@Mara I've just been messing with it :upside_down:
Everything on there should be UTC now :smile:
in the google calendar interface it now shows nothing anymore. not Brisbane or UTC, just.. no mention of timezone. :upside_down:
Well... That's helpful :big_smile: It looks like the interface is now UTC for me
...Without saying it
@Amanieu were you able to make some triage today? We're in Zoom now
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3AT-libs+label%3AI-nominated
Thanks all! We got through a bunch of issues today :smile:
If i come across issues/PRs that i think should be discussed in a libs meeting, do I ping rust-lang/libs, or someone specific, or just add I-nominated, or post a link here, or .. ?
Are there meeting notes somewhere?
@Mara feel free to just tag I-nominated and comment that you've nominated it on the issue
okay!
Sorry I've been very busy lately and don't have much time for Rust stuff. I'm hoping to have thing sorted out in about a month.
@Dirkjan Ochtman We just did triage this time, but I took notes on outcomes for the issues we looked at here: https://hackmd.io/QSbIBPgBRM2f2ycg5Ie9JA?view
Is anyone following up on these outcomes? (Starting those FCPs etc.)
@Mara I should've noted in the notes. I have a regular block of time on Friday's (today for me) to follow up on this stuff so am going to run through and drop notes and issue FCPs shortly :smile:

iirc, last meeting we briefly discussed the possibility of doing another triage after a week (so this wednesday). but i forgot what the conclusion was. i don't see anything in the calendar, so i guess no triage this week, and next meeting is next week?
@Mara I think the conclusion was we‚Äôll just run ok the regular 2 week schedule so do some more triage next week üôÇ
ah cool, thanks.
@Ashley Mannix on a similar note, is it okay if I nominate some pull requests to be looked at / sped up / discussed during the meeting?
@DPC Definitely! I think we should aim to get to a point where we can work through all of our I-nominated issues regularly so that anything that pops up needs attention
thanks. gonna mark the PRs as s-waiting-on-team so you can filter on those
In reference to this, is there a sense of whether withoutboats is still (able) to participate?
I thought he was starting a new job at Apple and could no longer do OSS work?
@Dirkjan Ochtman boats isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúhe‚Äù üôÇ If they‚Äôre not able to participate right now I think we could just restart a FCP on it and let that run through normally then
I think that would make boats the third libs member that's been pulled into the apple event horizon
yeah shit, I was going to write "they", sorry about that -- looks like I can't edit it now
thanks for pushing forward on that issue
Who are the other libs members pulled into Apple?
huon back in the day, and I think someone else around that time, but I can't remember who
